member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.AllowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is allowed as an input even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DisallowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is disallowed as an input even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that an output may be null even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that an output will not be null even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that when a method returns , the parameter may be null even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter may be null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets the return value condition.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that when a method returns , the parameter will not be null even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter will not be null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets the return value condition.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the output will be non-null if the named parameter is non-null.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the associated parameter name.
member.param: The associated parameter name. The output will be non-null if the argument to the parameter specified is non-null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute.ParameterName
member.summary: Gets the associated parameter name.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnAttribute
member.summary: Applied to a method that will never return under any circumstance.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the method will not return if the associated Boolean parameter is passed the specified value.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified parameter value.
member.param: The condition parameter value. Code after the method will be considered unreachable by diagnostics if the argument to the associated parameter matches this value.

member.summary: Gets the condition parameter value.

member.summary: The request was canceled

member.summary: The operation complexity was exceeded.

member.name: F:HotChocolate.ErrorCodes.Execution.ComplexityStateInvalid
member.summary: The analyzer needs a documentId, operationId, document and coerced variables.

member.name: F:HotChocolate.ErrorCodes.Execution.PersistedQueryNotFound
member.summary: A persisted query was not found when using the active persisted query pipeline.

member.name: F:HotChocolate.ErrorCodes.Execution.CannotCastParent
member.summary: Cannot cast the parent type to the resolver requested type.

member.name: F:HotChocolate.ErrorCodes.Execution.OneOfNoFieldSet
member.summary: The Oneof Input Objects `{0}` require that exactly one field must be supplied and that field must not be `null`. Oneof Input Objects are a special variant of Input Objects where the type system asserts that exactly one of the fields must be set and non-null.

member.name: F:HotChocolate.ErrorCodes.Execution.OneOfMoreThanOneFieldSet
member.summary: More than one field of the Oneof Input Object `{0}` is set. Oneof Input Objects are a special variant of Input Objects where the type system asserts that exactly one of the fields must be set and non-null.

member.name: F:HotChocolate.ErrorCodes.Execution.OneOfFieldIsNull
member.summary: `null` was set to the field `{0}`of the Oneof Input Object `{1}`. Oneof Input Objects are a special variant of Input Objects where the type system asserts that exactly one of the fields must be set and non-null.

member.name: F:HotChocolate.ErrorCodes.Execution.OneOfFieldMustBeNonNull
member.summary: Value for oneof field {field.FieldName} must be non-null.

member.summary: The multipart form could not be read.

member.summary: No 'operations' specified.

member.summary: No object paths specified for a key in the 'map'.

member.summary: The variable path must start with `variables`.

member.name: F:HotChocolate.ErrorCodes.Paging.NodeTypeUnknown
member.summary: Unable to infer the element type from the current resolver. This often happens if the resolver is not an iterable type like IEnumerable, IQueryable, IList etc. Ensure that you either explicitly specify the element type or that the return type of your resolver is an iterable type.

member.name: F:HotChocolate.ErrorCodes.Paging.SchemaTypeInvalid
member.summary: The element schema type for pagination must be a valid GraphQL output type (ObjectType, InterfaceType, UnionType, EnumType, ScalarType).

member.name: F:HotChocolate.ErrorCodes.Paging.MaxPaginationItems
member.summary: The maximum allowed items per page were exceeded.

member.name: F:HotChocolate.ErrorCodes.Paging.NoPagingBoundaries
member.summary: You must provide a `first` or `last` value to properly paginate the connection.

member.name: T:HotChocolate.SchemaCoordinate
member.summary:
A is a human readable string that uniquely identifies a schema element within a GraphQL Schema. A schema element is a specific instance of a named type, field, input field, enum value, field argument, directive, or directive argument. A is always unique. Each schema element may be referenced by exactly one possible schema coordinate.
A may refer to either a defined or built-in schema element. For example, `String` and `@deprecated(reason:)` are both valid schema coordinates which refer to built-in schema elements. However it must not refer to a meta-field. For example, `Business.__typename` is not a valid schema coordinate.
SchemaCoordinate : - Name - Name . Name - Name . Name ( Name : ) - @ Name - @ Name ( Name : )

member.name: M:HotChocolate.SchemaCoordinate.#ctor(HotChocolate.NameString,System.Nullable{HotChocolate.NameString},System.Nullable{HotChocolate.NameString},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of
member.exception: - A directive cannot contain a . - A . without a is only allowed on directive coordinates.

member.summary: Specifies if this is a coordinate of a directive.

member.name: P:HotChocolate.SchemaCoordinate.Name
member.summary: The name of the referenced

member.name: P:HotChocolate.SchemaCoordinate.MemberName
member.summary: The optional name of the referenced field or enum value

member.name: P:HotChocolate.SchemaCoordinate.ArgumentName
member.summary: The optional name of the referenced argument

member.summary: Gets the syntax representation of this .

member.name: M:HotChocolate.SchemaCoordinate.ToString
member.summary: Gets the string representation of this .

member.summary: Tries to parse a from a .
member.param: The string that may represent a .
If the string represented a valid schema coordinate string this will be the parsed schema coordinate.
member.returns: true if the string was a valid representation of a schema coordinate.

member.summary: Parses a schema coordinate string representation.
member.returns: Returns the parses schema coordinate.

member.summary: Creates a from a .
member.returns: Returns the instance.

member.summary: A service is rented for each resolver execution. Pooled services need to be registered as on the resolver's .

member.summary: Gets the runtime type. The runtime type defines of which value the type is when it manifests in the execution engine.

member.name: T:HotChocolate.Types.IInputType
member.summary:
Represents types that can be used as argument types or as variable types. These types essentially specify the data that can be passed into a GraphQL server.
Spec: https://spec.graphql.org/draft/#sec-Input-and-Output-Types

member.name: T:HotChocolate.Types.IType
member.summary: Represents a GraphQL type.

member.name: P:HotChocolate.Types.IType.Kind
member.summary: Gets the type kind.

member.name: T:HotChocolate.Types.ITypeSystemMember
member.summary: This marker interface identifies member of the type system like types, directives, the schema or fields and arguments.

member.name: T:HotChocolate.Types.TypeKind
member.summary: Specifies the GraphQL type kind.

member.name: F:HotChocolate.Types.TypeKind.Object
member.summary:
GraphQL operations are hierarchical and composed, describing a tree of information. While Scalar types describe the leaf values of these hierarchical operations, Objects describe the intermediate levels.
GraphQL Objects represent a list of named fields, each of which yield a value of a specific type. Object values should be serialized as ordered maps, where the selected field names (or aliases) are the keys and the result of evaluating the field is the value, ordered by the order in which they appear in the selection set.
All fields defined within an Object type must not have a name which begins with "__" (two underscores), as this is used exclusively by GraphQLs introspection system.

member.name: F:HotChocolate.Types.TypeKind.Union
F:HotChocolate.Types.TypeKind.InputObject
F:HotChocolate.Types.TypeKind.Enum
member.summary:
GraphQL Enum types, like Scalar types, also represent leaf values in a GraphQL type system. However Enum types describe the set of possible values.
Enums are not references for a numeric value, but are unique values in their own right. They may serialize as a string: the name of the represented value.
In this example, an Enum type called Direction is defined:
enum Direction { NORTH EAST SOUTH WEST }

member.name: F:HotChocolate.Types.TypeKind.Scalar
F:HotChocolate.Types.TypeKind.List
member.summary: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

member.name: F:HotChocolate.Types.TypeKind.NonNull
member.summary: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

member.name: F:HotChocolate.Types.TypeKind.Directive
member.summary:
A GraphQL schema describes directives which are used to annotate various parts of a GraphQL document as an indicator that they should be evaluated differently by a validator, executor, or client tool such as a code generator.
http://spec.graphql.org/draft/#sec-Type-System.Directives
